moves.1. e4 f6: This is not a recommended defense.  This is me messing around.
moves.2. Nc3 b6: This move takes the game completely off the rails of standard play by the records of the database.
moves.3. Bc4 e6 4. Qh5+ Ke7 5. d3 Qe8 6. Qxe8+: I learned my lesson; hopefully White also learned not to exchange quite so easily, as it gave up huge pressure and positional advantage.
moves.7. Nf3 Bb7 8. Nd4 Kf7 9. Ndb5 Bd6 10. Nx: A critical mistake with the pieces undeveloped.  12. ... Nc3 saves so much trouble it's not funny.
Let's just pretend that never happened.  12. Nf3 but I had to be aggressive.  (I'm trying to teach myself a lesson here, don't mind me.)
moves.19... Nd4 20. Bd2 Rc8 21. c5 bxc5: Trying for a strong pawn center to salvage something... maybe.
Thanks for offering the draw, muginz; we both know you had this won.  I was planning to resign after you queened, but hey.
